TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: izua sitsuayan i pasazayazaya tua tapaw ni Luvutsi a tapaw ni Savałi a Pasusu katua kina.
izoa sicoayan i pasazayazaya toa tapaw ni Lovoci a tapaw ni Savalji a Pasoso katoa kina.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time above the Luvutsi house was the house of Savałi Pasusu and her mother.

S.FORM: sa ti Savałi "muri vaik aken a sema tjatjan, kina.
sa ti Savalji "mori vaik aken a sema tjatjan, kina.
S.TRANSL: Savałi said: “I’m going to the spring, mother.

S.FORM: łakua maya semutsaqev a ku tjałev," aya ti Savałi; sa vaik a sema tjatjan.
ljakoa maya semocaqev a ko tjaljev," aya ti Savalji; sa vaik a sema tjatjan.
S.TRANSL: But don’t take the lid off my box,” said Savałi, and went off to the spring.

S.FORM: manu "anema siayaya nua ku ałak?
mano "anema siayaya noa ko aljak?
S.TRANSL: “What is my child talking about?

S.FORM: ku qayamaw," aya azua kina, sa sutsaqevi a tjałev.
ko qayamaw," aya azoa kina, sa socaqevi a tjaljev.
S.TRANSL: I’ll have a look,” said her mother; and she took the lid off the box.

S.FORM: manu minvar a ałak nua qatjuvi sema tu nazuazuanga.
mano minvar a aljak noa qatjovi sema to nazoazoanga.
S.TRANSL: Then young snakes scattered everywhere.

S.FORM: azua ti Savałi a muri tsemikel a kasi tjatjan, metsevung katu ałak nua qatjuvi.
azoa ti Savalji a mori cemikel a kasi tjatjan, mecevong kato aljak noa qatjovi.
S.TRANSL: Savałi was going to come back from the spring, and met a young snake.

S.FORM: "aa masa sinutsaqevan anga ni kina," aya.
"aa masa sinocaqevan anga ni kina," aya.
S.TRANSL: “Ah, that’s because mother has taken the lid off,” she thought.

S.FORM: sa djemałun i tapaw sa kiqenetjan a tjałev; nekanga a ałak.
sa djemaljon i tapaw sa kiqenetjan a tjaljev; nekanga a aljak.
S.TRANSL: She reached the house and looked at the box. There were no young snakes.

S.FORM: qau matjalaw ti Savałi.
qao matjalaw ti Savalji.
S.TRANSL: Savałi was angry.

S.FORM: "aku su ayain a ku ałak?
"ako so ayain a ko aljak?
S.TRANSL: “Why did you do that to my children?

S.FORM: muri vaik anga ken a djemavats," aya ti Savałi.
mori vaik anga ken a djemavac," aya ti Savalji.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to walk away,” said Savałi.

S.FORM: sa mirava tua nanemanemanga, sa kemuidi, sa vaik a sema katsedas.
sa mirava toa nanemanemanga, sa kemoidi, sa vaik a sema kacedas.
S.TRANSL: And she packed up everything, and put on a bamboo hat, and went off to the east.

S.FORM: a kina "maya vaik, maya vaik," aya.
a kina "maya vaik, maya vaik," aya.
S.TRANSL: Her mother said: “Don’t go, don’t go!”

S.FORM: vaik a kitjavilił a kina, aya.
vaik a kitjavililj a kina, aya.
S.TRANSL: And her mother followed behind her, they say.

S.FORM: qau djemałun i łavek, sa vaik i taladj tua łavek.
qao djemaljon i ljavek, sa vaik i taladj toa ljavek.
S.TRANSL: She came to the sea, and went into the sea.

S.FORM: qau maqelidi maqelidi a kuidi.
qao maqelidi maqelidi a koidi.
S.TRANSL: Her hat floated round and round,

S.FORM: qau maulaw.
qao maolaw.
S.TRANSL: and it disappeared.

S.FORM: qau mavan anga nu siaya Tjisavałi, aya tjautsikel a sitsuayan.
qao mavan anga no siaya Tjisavalji, aya tjaocikel a sicoayan.
S.TRANSL: And that’s why the place is called Tjisavałi, according to the old story.

S.FORM: azua ti Savałi namavunglay tua valałvał kasi łavek.
azoa ti Savalji namavonglay toa valaljvalj kasi ljavek.
S.TRANSL: Savałi had become pregnant by the monster from the sea.

S.FORM: saka masa navaik a tsemikel a sema łavek itjua
saka masa navaik a cemikel a sema ljavek itjoa
S.TRANSL: valałvał.
